instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message:
First i want to say that this forum is awesome. Thank you Duke!!!

I am working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board

When i start the machine i got no video. The backlight is there. The machine is booting but i cannot see a picture. When the machine boots i can hear a sound when pressing the enter key for example. This means that the machine is booting fine. There is no video on HDMI and no video on DP.

i meassured all the voltages for GPU rails. They are all fine. Don´t know what to do next. I know that there are two graphic cards and that the Mux is controlling them. But no idea how to make the next step.
I forgot to mention that the board is not water damaged and looks abolutely fine. No corrosion at all.

Any ideas?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: You sure the backlight is there, is the Apple logo lit up? If backlight is present the LCD should also work so I suspect a bad LCD assembly.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message:
Thank you Duke!

Yes, i´m 100% sure. The Apple logo lit up.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: If the LCD is bad then i would have a picture on HDMi or DP? Am i right?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: Disconnect internal LCD and boot with LCD connected to DP port through VGA/DVI adapter. Should have boot screen then

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: i already tried this with disconnected internal LCD. No screen

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: I still think a bad LCD. If backlight works it means eDP interface to LCD is ok. Find a test assembly for the correct year of the machine.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: Ok, but what about the fact that there is no HDMI and DP output?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: Don't know how 3787 behaves with boot screen through DP. Sometimes the OS needs to fully load the drivers for it to work.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: Ok, thank you Duke ! I´ll try to find a known good Display and try my best. Maybe even the HDMI is working only when the OS is fully loaded

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message:
OK, thank you Duke! I´ll try to find a known good Display for test. Maybe even HDMI is only working when OS is fully loaded.
Ohhh, i posted this twice.....hehe

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: Just an update...... When i plug the HDMI cable in i can see the extern LCD Monitor looks like the internal LCD. It´s just the same. You can see a black screen and it´s shining like the backlight from the internal LCD.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: Is this when the machine is booted in OSX?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: It´s from the beginning on

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: I hade the same problem with a3115 card and change the lvds connector after that i got pictures

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: 3115 is LVDS this board is eDP. eDP works or it doesn't, there is no in between.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message:
Hello Duke,

ok, now i tested with a known good display. No screen. Than i tested my display on the other machine. Working fine. Now it´s 100% sure that the Logic Board is faulty.

Any ideas?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: Seeing that HDMI and eDP give the exact same symptoms I would suspect the GPU is bad.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: Duke, is it possible to get this graphic chip? Any informations about that?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: Check Ebay or Ali. Honestly I would not continue with this repair, too much risk of failure, fake chips etc.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: One last general question....... What are you telling your customers when a board is not fixible or like in my case with this board. What advice can i give. To sell the machine as defect? :))

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: I just say I cannot fix it, case closed. Probably the best option is to dump it on Ebay, prices for such machines even broken are stupid high. Probably $500 for a broken one.....

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: Did you check L8300?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display
threads.message: It is eDP interface, only one data line has to have an issue and there is no image/backlight, nothing.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video on display

[USER="557"]MDY[/USER]

i didn´t check it anymore. I follow Duke´s advice. It´s better to not put my hands on this graphic chip and change it when chance is high to get a problem later on.
Therefore the customer will get this machine back.
